Game.Name: Pitfall - The Mayan Adventure (USA, Europe)
Game.plot: Overview:Released in 1994 for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega Genesis, and Sega CD. In 1995, it was released for the Sega 32X, Atari Jaguar, and PC. In 2001, it was ported to the Game Boy Advance. In 2009, the Sega Genesis version was released on the Nintendo Wii's Wii Shop as a Virtual Console title.Plot:Pitfall Harry, from the original Atari 2600 classic Pitfall!, has gotten himself into trouble, and it's up to his son, Pitfall Harry Jr. to save him.Easter EggsAs an Easter Egg, the original Atari 2600 game can be played by finding a secret door marked by a sprite of a scorpion from the original game.Cheat: 9 continuesAt the Continue screen, press Start repeatedly.Cheat: 9 continuesFirst waste all of your lives on the first level, then when the continue screen pops up, press B three times. If done corectly then the countdown should stop, thus allowing you to continue forever.
Game.Notes: The Mayan Adventure for Game Boy Advance is a jaw-dropping example of GBA's ability to deliver beautiful graphics. Controlling Pitfall Harry Jr. -- son of the Pitfall Harry from the Atari 2600 game that the SNES game was a sequel to -- you must venture deep into the South American jungle in search of adventure and treasure. Complex puzzles and challenging boss battles become more and more daunting as you progress further into the game's 11 vibrant levels.
